etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Science. From scientific Latin Monograptidae, family name from Monograptus, genus name from mono- + Hellenistic Greek γραπτός marked with letters; in ancient Greek ‘painted’) + -idae

definitions: Of, relating to, or designating graptolites of the Silurian and Devonian family Monograptidae, characterized by a single series of thecae in each rhabdosome.
A graptolite of the family Monograptidae.
